subject: Travel
title: How Railways Changed Food
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: How Railways Changed Food.

hook.text: Before railways, most people ate only what grew within 20 miles of their home.

buildup.text: Fresh milk spoiled in hours. Meat had to be salted. Tropical fruits were unknown outside port cities.

discovery.text: Refrigerated train cars changed everything. Fresh meat from Chicago reached New York in two days.

twist.text: Bananas went from an exotic luxury to America's favorite fruit within one generation thanks to rail.

climax.text: Railways created the modern supermarket. Every aisle exists because trains made national distribution possible.

punchline.text: Your grocery store is a product of the railway age.

quiz.question: How did railways change the food industry?
options: Refrigerated cars allowed fresh food to travel long distances
